HARSH.Definition: cruel or severe in manner or nature

AUTHORITARIAN.Definition: demanding obedience and refusing to allow people freedom to act as they wish

PODIUM.Definition: a raised platform on which a speaker stands to address an audience

SETTING ASIDE.Definition: putting it aside or allocating it for that purpose

PLAYING RUSSIAN ROULETTE.Definition: engaging in a risky or dangerous activity with uncertain results

CRASHED.Definition: suddenly fell or dropped significantly in value

GANG.Definition: a group of people who engage in criminal activities

EXAGGERATION.Definition: an act of making it seem more extreme or intense than it really was

AN END IN SIGHT.Definition: the prospect or likelihood of the situation improving

TRUCE.Definition: a temporary agreement to stop fighting

GANGS.Definition: groups of people, often involved in criminal activities

BULLETS.Definition: the small metal objects that are fired from guns

SOARED.Definition: rose or increased fast to a great height

DETERRENT.Definition: something that discouraged them or prevented them from investing

UNDER ITS WATCH.Definition: during its period of responsibility or oversight

WIDE-RANGING.Definition: extensive or covering a wide variety of areas

SETTING OUT.Definition: beginning or embarking on a course of action

CLOSE THE DOOR ON.Definition: end or put an end to it

EXCEPTIONALLY.Definition: unusually or remarkably, to a high degree

APPROACHABLE.Definition: friendly, accessible, or easy to talk to

BOY-WONDER.Definition: a young person who was exceptionally talented or successful

RUFFLED THE FEATHERS.Definition: upset or disturbed them, especially by challenging their authority

FAST FORWARD.Definition: moving quickly to a future point in time

LANDSLIDE.Definition: a decisive victory or great majority

CHARISMATIC.Definition: charming, attractive, and having natural leadership qualities

BLISSFULLY.Definition: in a way that provided perfect happiness or great joy

ROUND UP.Definition: gather together or collect, especially forcefully or by means of a search

ROUNDED UP.Definition: gathered together or collected forcefully or by means of a search

RAISED ALARM BELLS.Definition: caused concern or alerted others to potential problems

SHAVED.Definition: having hair removed from, especially closely or completely

MATTRESSES.Definition: fabric cases filled with soft material, used for sleeping on

FELLOW.Definition: people in the same position, involved in the same activity

GLAMOROUS.Definition: attractive or exciting in a showy way

POLLS.Definition: surveys or studies made to gather public opinion

CRACKDOWNS.Definition: a series of severe measures to restrict illegal people or behaviour

INCARCERATED.Definition: confined or imprisoned in a jail

DECIMATED.Definition: greatly reduced in number or destroyed

TURF.Definition: territory or areas claimed or controlled by gangs

EXTORTION.Definition: the practice of obtaining money, through force or threats

TENDENCIES.Definition: likely ways of doing things, inclinations towards a particular type of behaviour or action

REINTERPRETED.Definition: explained or made sense of it again or differently

BRUSHING ASIDE.Definition: dismissing or treating as not important

PRIDES.Definition: feels a deep sense of satisfaction or pleasure in it

BRUTALISED.Definition: treated people in a savage and violent way

EXTORTED.Definition: obtained money by force or threats

ROT AWAY BEHIND BARS.Definition: decline or decay while in prison

UPSTANDING.Definition: honest, respectable, and obeying the law

BULLET.Definition: the small metal object that is fired from a gun

EXPLOITED.Definition: used unfairly or to their advantage

LOOSE THEME.Definition: general or flexible topic or subject
